programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the PGA Tour's Truist Championship, taking place at the Philadelphia Cricket Club. 2025 Masters champion Rory McIlroy claimed victory last season.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film1999
programme.desc: The official film of the 1999 PGA Championship from Medinah Country Club in Medinah, Illinois, where Tiger Woods would win his first PGA Championship and second Major at the age of 23.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2000
programme.desc: The official film of the 2000 PGA Championship from Valhalla Golf Club in Louisville, Kentucky, where Tiger Woods would win his second straight PGA Championship and fifth Major overall.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2006
programme.desc: The official film of the 2006 PGA Championship from Medinah Country Club in Medinah, Illinois, where Tiger Woods went on to win his third PGA Championship and 12th overall Major.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2007
programme.desc: The official film of the 2007 PGA Championship from Southern Hills Country Club in Tulsa, Oklahoma, where Tiger Woods won his fourth PGA Championship and 13th overall Major.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2011
programme.desc: The official film of the 2011 PGA Championship from the Atlanta Athletic Club in Johns Creek, Georgia. Germany's Martin Kaymer entered this tournament as defending champion.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2013
programme.desc: The official film of the 2013 PGA Championship from Oak Hill Country Club in Pittsford, New York. Rory McIlroy entered this tournament as defending champion.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2015
programme.desc: The official film of the 2015 PGA Championship from Whistling Straits in Wisconsin. Rory McIlroy entered this tournament as defending champion.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2016
programme.desc: The official film of the 2016 PGA Championship from Baltusrol Golf Club in New Jersey. Australian golfer Jason Day entered the tournament as defending champion.

programme.title: WTA Final: Stuttgart
programme.desc: In Stuttgart, world number one Aryna Sabalenka, a three-time runner-up in this competition, meets Jelena Ostapenko for a clash in the final. (21.04)

programme.title: Bitesize Tennis Classics
programme.desc: British tennis legend Tim Henman joins Gigi Salmon on the Sky Sports Tennis podcast to answer 10 questions about his life and career.

programme.title: Billie Jean King: My Story
programme.desc: Billie Jean King discusses her life story, including her ongoing fight for equality and the victories on and off the court that have shaped her into the legend she is today.

programme.title: Martina Navratilova: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Martina Navratilova sits down with Gigi Salmon for an in-depth interview about her life, tennis career and the challenges she has overcome.

programme.title: McEnroe v Borg 1981
programme.desc: In winning the 1981 US Open men's singles title, John McEnroe inflicted a career-ending defeat upon long-time rival Bjorn Borg, as the Swede later retired from the professional game.

programme.title: ATP 2025 Season Final Hlts
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper steps on court for the Madrid Open final aiming to lift his second Masters 1000 crown, as the 23-year-old faces 14th seed Casper Ruud for the first time. (04.05)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)
